intro: Galearia fragifera subsp. bonnanii, commonly known as the fragrant snowbell, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. It produces small, edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, particularly in cooler climates.
